intro: Hedyotis centranthoides f. kohala, commonly known as the Kohala bedstraw, is a rare Hawaiian plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of tiny white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showcasing adaptations to the harsh conditions of its native environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered. Conservation efforts are crucial to preserve this unique botanical species.
